title: Fried Green Tomato BLT
description: Crisp, cornmeal-crusted green tomatoes layered with smoky bacon, peppery lettuce, and a tangy mayo on toasted bread. The contrast of crunchy fried tomatoes, salty bacon and bright herbs makes this a memorable twist on a classic BLT.

ingredients.notes: about 1–1.25 lb total; discard small end pieces
cook until just crisp, drain and keep warm

ingredients.display_name: sandwich bread slices, sturdy (sourdough or country)
lettuce leaves (romaine or butter lettuce), washed and dried

ingredients.notes: can mix with lemon and scallion for flavored mayo
for coating tomatoes to help crust adhere
for first dredge to help cornmeal stick
seasoned with salt and spices for crust
enough for shallow frying to 1/4–1/2-inch depth

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: wash and dry tomatoes, slice into 1/2-inch rounds; pat dry. Fry bacon in a skillet until just crisp, transfer to paper towels and keep warm; toast bread and set aside. Make flavored mayo by stirring scallion and lemon zest into mayonnaise if using.
Set up dredging station: one shallow bowl with flour; one bowl with beaten eggs whisked with buttermilk; one wide shallow dish with seasoned cornmeal mixed with salt, pepper and smoked paprika.
Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high until a small pinch of cornmeal sizzles and bubbles (to about 175–180°C / 350–360°F equivalent). Adjust heat to maintain steady sizzle but not smoking.
Dredge each tomato slice: lightly dust in flour, dip into egg-buttermilk mixture allowing excess to drip, then press into cornmeal to form an even coating. Work in batches to avoid crowding.

Fry coated tomato slices in hot oil in a single layer, 2–3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crisp. Flip carefully with tongs; do not overcrowd. Transfer to a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate and season immediately with a pinch of salt.

Assemble sandwiches: spread mayo on one slice of toasted bread, layer lettuce, bacon, two fried green tomato slices (per sandwich), additional mayo on the top slice, then close sandwich. Cut in half and serve while tomatoes are warm.
Cleanup and finishing: discard oil appropriately when cooled, wipe down surfaces, and optionally serve with lemon wedges or extra mayo on the side.
